1.text: Heeey, rookie! Welcome to the grease pit. Hope you brought your sense of humor — 'cause you’re gonna need it.

options.text: 4. You look like you haven’t slept.

2.text: This place eats people alive, man. Not, like, *literally* — ha! Unless... well, maybe.

3.text: Yeah, yeah, 'nice to meet you' — that’s what Gary said too. Before the fryer started humming his name.

4.text: Ha! That’s the *scent of profit*, my friend. Grease, fear, and despair — all cooked to perfection.

options.text: 1. You really love this job, huh?
2. I think I’m gonna be sick.

5.text: Sleep? Nah. Every time I close my eyes, I hear the fryer bubbling... like it’s breathing. You ever heard oil breathe?

6.text: Worried? Nah! Terrified? Maybe! But don’t tell Gristle I said that — he thinks laughter keeps the grease calm.

options.text: 1. The manager said the same thing about staying quiet.

7.text: Gary used to clean the filters. One night he said the oil looked like it had eyes. Next shift, the oil was thicker. Redder.

8.text: Yeah, yeah, I’m just kidding! Hahaha... ha... why aren’t you laughing?

9.text: Love it? Nah. But if I keep laughing, maybe it won’t notice me. Maybe it only likes the quiet ones.

10.text: You’ll see. Everyone does. Just don’t stop laughing when the oil starts moving. It likes the sound.

11.text: Don’t ask that. It listens. It *always* listens. Just... keep flipping burgers, rookie.
